捧.definition: to hold or offer with both hands; to sing the praises of; classifier for what can be held in both hands

捧上天.definition: to praise to the skies; to shower with excessive praise

捧哏.definition: straight man (supporting role in comic dialogue 對口相聲|对口相声[dui4kou3 xiang4sheng1]); (of a straight man) to react with exasperation to the silliness of the funny man 逗哏[dou4gen2]

捧場.definition: to show one's support for a performer or theatrical troupe etc by attending their show; to attend an event to cheer on the participants; to patronize a restaurant or store; to sing the praises of

捧托.definition: to hold up with both hands

捧杯.definition: to hold the winner's trophy; to win the championship

捧殺.definition: to praise sb in a way that does them harm (e.g. by causing them to become complacent)

捧紅.definition: to make popular; to make famous

捧腹.definition: to split one's sides laughing; to roar with laughter; (lit.) to hold one's belly with both hands

捧腹絕倒.definition: to laugh until it hurts; to laugh heartily

捧角.definition: to applaud and praise a favorite actor
